entries: Created github io page and added devlog page
Added visual changes to github io page

Designed a console script to open all reddit posts in a new window:
$('a.title').each(function(){window.open(this.href, '_blank')};
Modified devlogs to be for developer, not for particular project.
Fixed the footer problem in devlogs and sent PR #3

Fixed JSON problem #6
Uncaught SyntaxError: Unexpected token o
Wasn't showing up when I ran it on my local lampp installation so it took a couple of commit to solve this (Testing was done on the github io page itself.
Switch workspaces in ubuntu with Ctrl + Alt + arrow Key

Correcting misspells in syncope reference guide. #19
Changed the following:
src/main/asciidoc/commondocs/guiinstaller.adoc
src/main/asciidoc/concepts/provisioning/provisioning.adoc
src/main/asciidoc/iam/accessmanager/accessmanager.adoc
src/main/asciidoc/iam/accessmanager/authentication.adoc
src/main/asciidoc/iam/iam.adoc
src/main/asciidoc/iam/identitystores.adoc
src/main/asciidoc/iam/provisioningengines.adoc
src/main/asciidoc/introduction/history.adoc
Got mentioned in a tweet by Apache Syncope
Read about Maru OS which is going to go open source. Now reading up on AOSP docs to get ready for trying to port to OPO
Helped foobarbecue from meteor irc to fix export problems in js
Reading about Apache Wicket which is used by Apache Syncope for console backend. Even Xbox One store uses this.

How to create a link to a page (realms in the example below) in syncope (as seen in BasePage.java)
BookmarkablePageLink link = BookmarkablePageLinkBuilder.build("realms", Realms.class);
MetaDataRoleAuthorizationStrategy.authorize(link, WebPage.ENABLE, StandardEntitlement.REALM_LIST);
Widgets on the dashboard are made from WebMarkupContainer (See NumberWidget.java Line 38)

Adding mouse down listeners is done by the following code:
new AjaxEventBehavior("onmousedown"){
    @Override
    protected void onEvent(AjaxRequestTarget target) { ... }
}
Apache issues is down for some reason. See Screenshot But, down for more than a week? That's not right...
Issues page works now. Posted an issue, check it out at SYNCOPE-871.

Turns out, there are methods in DashboardOverviewPanel named buildTotalAny1OrRoles and buildTotalAny2OrRoles which check if admin has added any objects other than printers and based on that, widgets on the dashboard are generated. I proposed a way to work around this problem in this comment.
sudo netstat -plnt | grep ':80' shows the process listening to port 80, fuser -k 8080/tcp kills the process listening to port 8080.
Started working on a fix for SYNCOPE-871
